page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN HINXWORTH AREA
page.content: Transport in the area is dominated by the private car. The major A1 (London to Edinburgh) trunk route allows rapid access to north and south, and is a significant factor in enabling people to live in rural surroundings whilst working considerable distances away, even in London. As there is almost no employment in the area the car (or in some cases the motorbike) is essential in enabling people to get to work. Some of the elderly do not have a car; for them life here can be very awkward as public transport is mimimal. The bus service is a twice weekly return trip to Biggleswade, necessary, as we don't have any local shops. All the children have bicycles for fun and some adults have cycles for pleasure and fitness. There is one electric bicycle in the village which is considered to be a novelty.
